clinical_study.brief_title: Selective Digestive Decontamination in Carriers of Carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella Pneumoniae
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized,Double-Blind,Placebo-Controled Trial of Selective Digestive Decontamination Using Oral Gentamicin and Oral Polymyxin E for Eradication of Carbapenem-Resistant Klebsiella Pneumoniae Carriage

brief_summary.textblock: There is an urgent need to control our current national outbreak of carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae (CRKP). The purpose of this study is to eradicate CRKP gastrointestinal carriage using selective digestive decontamination (SDD); with buccal and oral gentamicin and polymyxin E administration. This will reduce infections and hopefully mortality caused by CRKP.

primary_outcome.measure: Eradication of CRKP carriage measured by negative rectal swabs

secondary_outcome.measure: No new in-hospital acquisition of CRKP

arm_group.description: Oral solution of 0.45% saline and oral solution of H2O & saccharine. Oral gel composed of mineral oil, gelatine powder, pectin, sodium carboxymethylcellulose, polyethylene
Oral solution and buccal gel of gentamicin and polymyxin E

intervention.intervention_name: Arm #1 :Oral solution and buccal gel of gentamicin and polymyxin E. Arm #2: Placebo.
intervention.description: Arm #1: Oral gentamicin & polymyxin E, gentamicin & polymyxin E buccal gel. Arm #2: Oral placebo solutions, placebo buccal gel.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Hospitalized men and women with a positive rectal swab for CRKP
- Age 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age less than 18 years
- Pregnant women, lactating women
- A known allergy to the study drugs
